intro: Acmispon parviflorus, commonly known as the narrowleaf blueweed, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its small, pea-like flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. It has small, narrow leaves and produces clusters of blue to purple flowers that bloom in the spring. Acmispon parviflorus is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed areas.
